accuracy.description: The correct identification of information or resolution of the task based on the given question.

accepted_values.high: The information provided is completely accurate.
accepted_values.medium: The information provided is mostly accurate with minor errors.
accepted_values.low: The information provided contains significant inaccuracies.

reasoning_traceability.description: The ability to follow the logical steps or thought processes taken by the agents to reach the solution.

accepted_values.traceable: The reasoning steps can be clearly followed and understood.
accepted_values.partially_traceable: Some of the reasoning steps are evident, but others may not be clear.
accepted_values.not_traceable: The reasoning steps are not clear or not provided.

data_integrity.description: Ensuring that the data used to reach the solution is reliable and uncontaminated by external biases or inaccuracies.

accepted_values.intact: Data used is verified and free from contamination.
accepted_values.questionable: Data integrity is uncertain, with potential biases identified.
accepted_values.compromised: Data is unreliable, with clear signs of biases or contamination.

resourcefulness.description: The ability to use available resources efficiently to solve problems or gather information.

accepted_values.high: Resources are used in an innovative and efficient manner.
accepted_values.medium: Resources are used adequately with some room for improvement.
accepted_values.low: Inefficient or inappropriate use of resources.

efficiency.description: The degree to which the task is completed in a timely and cost-effective manner.

accepted_values.high: Task is completed quickly without unnecessary resource consumption.
accepted_values.medium: Task is completed in a reasonable timeframe with moderate resource use.
accepted_values.low: Task takes a long time to complete with excessive resource consumption.

solution_completeness.description: The extent to which the solution provided by the agents addresses all aspects of the task.

accepted_values.complete: Solution fully addresses the given task with all steps executed.
accepted_values.partial: Solution addresses some aspects of the task but is not fully complete.
accepted_values.incomplete: Solution fails to adequately address the fundamental aspects of the task.
